main event: A civilian observer reported seeing a disc-shaped object traveling at an estimated speed of 900-1500 mph near Culpeper, Virginia on June 3, 1949.
interesting points: The object was observed for 5-6 seconds.,The observer was an amateur astronomer and pilot.,The object was estimated to be the size of a 5 or 6 room house.,The object appeared silver and was shaped like an oyster.,The object banked into the sun at a terrific speed before disappearing.
witness description: Observer is a cabinet maker and amateur astronomer.
